data.name: 0000 (194.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Hey, Haruhi.

data.name: 0001 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: What? We're in a hurry right now...

data.name: 0002 (194.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: You said before that if there are aliens, time travelers or espers they should come to you.

data.name: 0003 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Yeah I said that. What of it?

data.name: 0004 (194.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: What would you think if I insisted that espers exist and are close to you?

data.name: 0005 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: That's simple.

data.name: 0006 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: I'd staple your mouth and nose shut, wrap you in bamboo and chuck you in a pool.

data.name: 0007 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: You said something like that before, didn't you?

data.name: 0008 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Give it a break.

data.name: 0010 (194.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Without even taking a moment to listen, she dashed off.

data.name: 0011 (194.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Good grief…

data.name: 0012 (194.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: I-I was thinking…

data.name: 0013 (194.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: Couldn't this perhaps be the work of espers?

data.name: 0015 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: …Mikuru, do you have a fever or something all of a sudden?

data.name: 0016 (194.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: A fever?! I don't have a fever--!

data.name: 0017 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: So what you're essentially trying to say is...

data.name: 0018 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: That this piano incident was done by an esper, right?

data.name: 0019 (194.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: U-umm... Something like that.

data.name: 0020 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Mikuru... You have to use your head more and think properly.

data.name: 0021 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: You got that? You see--ESP isn't your any ordinary kind of power.

data.name: 0022 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Not to mention, why would espers in a school during the summer holiday...

data.name: 0023 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: ...pull such a childish prank.

data.name: 0024 (194.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: W-well... That's...

data.name: 0025 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: I'd rather someone replaced the piano with one with an automatic performance feature.

data.name: 0026 (194.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: Eeeek...

data.name: 0027 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Come on, let's hurry up, Mikuru.

data.name: 0029 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: What's wrong, Nagato--stopping all of a sudden like that?

data.name: 0030 (194.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: Proposal of a possibility.

data.name: 0031 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Okay, go ahead.

data.name: 0032 (194.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: A being may have performed transcending the space causing the piano to make a sound.

data.name: 0033 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Performing transcending the space?

data.name: 0034 (194.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: To put it in other words--ESP.

data.name: 0035 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: …That's a surprisingly out-there theory for someone like you, Yuki, but it's far too cheap.

data.name: 0036 (194.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: …Really?

data.name: 0037 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: The thing about ESP is that it's not a power you just see all over the place.

data.name: 0038 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Not to mention--why would someone use that power to perform music?

data.name: 0039 (194.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: Perhaps… They have too much free time.

data.name: 0040 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Jeez, I don't need you to start saying the sort of things that Kyon would say now.

data.name: 0041 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: There's no way something like that would happen at a school during the summer holiday.

data.name: 0042 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: You've got me wondering what on earth you were talking about.

data.name: 0043 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Let's hurry on. Come on, run!

data.name: 0045 (194.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Miss Suzumiya--Do you believe in ESP?

data.name: 0046 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: ESP? Of course. Why?

data.name: 0047 (194.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Oh, I was just struck by a thought even I consider absurd…

data.name: 0048 (194.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: I was thinking about the piano--about what if it were an esper playing games with us.

data.name: 0049 (194.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: A remote performance, or means to convey their presence. Such could surely be possible.

data.name: 0050 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: That's such shallow reasoning. It's really unlike you, Koizumi.

data.name: 0051 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Something as rare as an esper isn't just gonna make its presence known so nonchalantly...

data.name: 0052 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: ...and easily.

data.name: 0053 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: There's not even any reason for it to pull something like that in the first place.

data.name: 0054 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: I wouldn't rule it out, but I can confidently declare it an extreme rare case.

data.name: 0055 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: This is something more profound--a more complex phenomenon. We can't think so cheaply.

data.name: 0056 (194.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Do excuse me. It was merely an idea I was struck with…

data.name: 0057 (194.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: But that sort of free thinking is important. I'm looking forward to your next deduction.

data.name: 0058 (194.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: I'll do my best to live up to your expectations.
